section.p: You are reminded of an evening you spent among the One-Eyed Crow clan, down on the windswept plains. Their bard told a tale of an ancient folk hero who vanquished a vast invulnerable maggot by repeatedly striking it on the snout - the one part of the creature that was susceptible to injury.
Bearing this in mind, you keep up a barrage of painful blows on the worm’s soft snout until it pulls back into the interior of the burrow. .
